problem_text:
Is there an integer n such that for all m > n the alternating group Am has no non-trivial Am-permutable subgroups? (See the definition in 17.112.)
A. F. Vasil’ev, A. N. Skiba
answer: Yes, there is (N. Yang, A. Galt, Bull. Malays. Math. Sci. Soc. (2), 46, no. 5 (2023), Paper no. 177, 16 p.).
